label: Sinai Arabic NF M 8, Undertext (Greek majuscule)

note: Round biblical majuscule. Copied by the same hand as the UTO “Hippocrates, Epidemics” (Rossetto)

note.value: Reconstructed folio order, ff. 8r+58r (col. a), 9v+61v (col. a), 51r (col. b), 61v (col. b), 58v (col. a), 61r (col. a), 58v (col. b)+8v, 61r (col. b)+9r
Original recto: 8r top+58r (col. a), 9v top+61v (col. a), 58r (col. b), 61v (col. b); original verso: 58v (col. a), 61r (col. a), 58v (col. b)+8v top, 61r (col. b )+9r top (Rossetto)
To the same original manuscript belong also folios from Sinai Arabic NF M 27 (Rossetto)

Common codicological and palaeographical features suggest that the three Hippocratic UTOs and the two other medical UTOs in this codex ("Antyllus?, Recipes for different diseases" and "Treatise on medical terms") belonged to the same original manuscript. The following folios could also possibly belong to "Hippocrates' Letters": 8r (middle piece), 8v (middle piece), 9r (middle piece), 9v (middle piece) (Rossetto)
Description of undertext by Agamemnon Tselikas, Nigel Wilson, Giulia Rossetto
